definition: to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]

sentences.english: They say you should never judge a book by its cover.
sentences.chinese: 人们说以貌取人是不对的。

sentences.english: Had a Mexican last name, but I don't judge people, you know?
sentences.chinese: 会有墨西哥的姓，但是我不会以貌取人的，你知道吗？

sentences.english: Whoever judges people with their appearance always underestimates others.
sentences.chinese: 不少人喜欢以貌取人，那样其实低估了人家的真本事。

sentences.english: You shouldn't judge a man only by his clothes.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该总是以貌取人。

sentences.english: We should judge a person by his appearance.
You may wrong and never judge a person from aspect .
sentences.chinese: 可能你错了且莫以貌取人。

sentences.english: He remarked that we mustn't judge people solely by their appearences.
sentences.chinese: 他说我们绝对不要只以貌取人。

sentences.english: B. Don't judge a book by its cover. Do you know his experience?
sentences.chinese: 不要以貌取人。你知道他的经历吗？

sentences.english: Fate has reminded me not to be such a judgmental harpy.
sentences.chinese: 命运提醒我，不要以貌取人。

sentences.english: Like it or not, people are often judged by their looks.
sentences.chinese: 不管你喜欢与否，人常以貌取人。

sentences.english: People judge you based on your appearance,
Also, I tell them do not judge a book by its cover.
sentences.chinese: 同样的，我告诉他们“不要以貌取人”。

definition: you can't judge a person by appearance, just as you can't measure the sea with a pint pot (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2
related.word: 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量

definition: you can't judge a person by appearance (idiom)/you can't judge a book by its cover/often in combination 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
see 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
pinyin: hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2

definition: (lit.) to take a part for the whole/to generalize
ugly people will do all kinds of weird things to get attention (idiom)
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
